Welcome to dandan’s documentation!¶

dandan package¶

Submodules¶

dandan.query module¶

dandan.query.html(url, **kwargs)¶

get html string object by url

kwargs:

timeout : set get timeout default 60 retry: set retry count default 0 headers: set http headers encoding: page encoding
notice:
default User-Agent : “Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; Win64; x64; rv:52.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/52.0”
dandan.query.json(url, **kwargs)¶
dandan.query.local_ip()¶

get local ip address

dandan.query.soup(url, **kwargs)¶

get BeautifulSoup object by url familiar html by return BeautifulSoup object

dandan.query.whois(ip)¶

get whois infommation (developing)

dandan.system module¶

dandan.system.clear()¶
dandan.system.execute(command, callback=None)¶

Execute a system command return status and output

Parameters:
  • command – execute command command must not bash command
  • callback – callback function per output line where callback not None
Returns:

tuple (output, status)
dandan.system.getch()¶
dandan.system.is_linux()¶
dandan.system.is_python2()¶
dandan.system.is_python3()¶
dandan.system.is_win32()¶
dandan.system.readable(path)¶

Check if a given path is readable by the current user.

Parameters:path – The path to check
Returns:True or False
dandan.system.set_unicode()¶
dandan.system.writeable(path, check_parent=True)¶

Check if a given path is writeable by the current user.

Parameters:
  • path – The path to check
  • check_parent – If the path to check does not exist, check for the ability to write to the parent directory instead
Returns:

True or False
